TopicTitle: Anyone noticed the "HUGE-3 Science Processing Bay"?

Articles.Content:
I haven't seen in mentioned anywhere, and managed to overlook it myself. Was quite amazed when I spotted it: a Kerbodyne-sized Lab module, short profile, with two cargo hatches at the sides.

The storage spaces are too small for a Science Jr. and not easily accessible by ladder, so they're not exactly suitable for science-y stuff. They comfortably hold a lot of fuel cells / batteries / RCS tanks, however, so you don't need to add a dedicated storage bin just for the small stuff.

Unfortunately, the ladder is sunk into the model and I have a hard time connecting it to surface-attached ladders.

In other news, it can hold 750 data for even MOAR Science.
There is no such part. You sure it's not from a mod?

I **AM** sure it's from a mod: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75074-1-0-Taurus-HCV-3-75-m-CSM-System-v1-5-01-Apr-27-2014](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75074-1-0-Taurus-HCV-3-75-m-CSM-System-v1-5-01-Apr-27-2014)

I also have it and I would guess it's from Taurus HCV (or whatever the exact name of that mod was) though I could be wrong. It isn't stock as far as I know.

Also, ninjad.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-17T12:01:02Z" title="05/17/2015 12:01  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 17, 2015</time> by xrayfishx**
You know a mod is good when you confuse it with stock parts. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
It's from Taurus MCV. Very OP since the data conversion rate is proportional to the amount contained in the bay. Plus the effective 1.75 multiplier... 30+ science/day with 3 1-star scientists.

> 
> There is no such part. You sure it's not from a mod?

> 
> You know a mod is good when you confuse it with stock parts. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

\*blush\*

(10 char)
